pattpack.expr_2
Class Expr

java.lang.Object
  pattpack.expr_2.Expr
Direct Known Subclasses:
Binary, Constant, TimedExpr
public abstract class Expr
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines the methods available in every expression. It also serves as a cache manager of expressions's values.

Field Summary

          The cache of expressions's values

protected abstract  int uncachedEval()
          This method computes the value of an expression from scratch, i.e., without using the cached value, if any exists.

Constructor Detail

Expr

public Expr()
Method Detail

eval

public int eval()
Evaluate this expressions. This method fetches the cached value of this expression. Subclasses may override it when computing the value from an expression's state is more efficient than fetching it, e.g., in a literal.

Returns:
The value of this expression.

uncachedEval

protected abstract int uncachedEval()
This method computes the value of an expression from scratch, i.e., without using the cached value, if any exists.

Returns:
The value of this expression.

cachedEval

private static int cachedEval(Expr key)
This method always return the value of an expression. First it tries to fetch the value of its argument from the cache. If no value has been cached already, it calls method uncachedEval, caches the value and also returns it.

Parameters:
key - The expression to evaluate.
Returns:
the value of the argument.
